comments.message: Hi Pierre, interesting post! Any chance you could find an image to go along with it? Images help grab attention and tell a story with higher impact. description: The idea of making the infected fluids more visually distinct grows from the observation that some pills I have taken in the past made my urine change color to greenish.   What if individuals who are confirmed Ebola-positive could be given a pill that will color all of their clear bodily fluids in a predictble way?  I would pull together a small group of experts and, assuming there was a choice of colorant, select a color for marking infected fluids that is culturally associated with danger or threat in West Africa.   Then I would have medical experts and some traditional healers brainstorm on selecting an orally-administerable substance known to act as the desired colorant.  Then I would mount a PSA campaign showing what the infected fluids look like, on bedding, on hazmat suits, on a linen-wrapped corpse, etc.
summary: Would it be possible to slow contact with Ebola-infected bodily fluids by making them more visually distinct?   By administering a colorant to confirmed individuals?
title: Make infected fluids more visibly distinct
